page.title: 01Rural Area,N.W.of Lewes
page.content: The 12 squares to the N.W. of Lewes divide into three distinct areas. To the south the four squares are covered by open downland much of which is used for agricultural purposes, mainly cereal crops.This area includes the old race course buildings and the site of the Battle of Lewes. Through the central four squares runs the steep scarp of the South Downs.The South Downs Way runs along the top edge of the scarp, passing the highest point,Black Cap,206 feet above sea level.The B2116 runs along the foot of the scarp. The northern four squares are in the valley.Many farms are situated here, the land being a patchwork of small fields,some with crops,others used for grazing cattle and sheep.The main Hastings to London railway line runs through the N.E.corner of this area.
